newsitem.title: INDIA: Delhi shares up on small oil price rise prospect.
newsitem.headline: Delhi shares up on small oil price rise prospect.

text.p: Delhi stocks edged higher in early trade on Wednesday after the petroleum minister was quoted as saying any increase in petroleum product prices would be negligible, brokers said.
After 30 minutes of trading, the Delhi Stock Exchange's benchmark index was up 1.54 points at 866.77.

The Economic Times on Wednesday quoted Petroleum Minister Janeshwar Mishra as saying India would raise the prices of petroleum products by the end of June, and the increase would be "almost negligible".
Brokers said foreign institutional investors (FIIs) concentrated on State Bank of India, Reliance Industries and other blue chips.
"Apart from FIIs' buying, the beginning of fresh settlement on the National Stock Exchange also fuelled speculative buying," Suresh Aggarwal of stockbrokers Jai Mata Securities said.
TISCO added one rupee to 190 on foreign buying.
Bajaj Auto jumped eight rupees to 920.
State Bank of India rose four rupees to 333 on large purchases by FIIs and speculators ahead of its results due on Thursday.
Nestle India surged four rupees to 293.
